channel.title: Let's Talk Photography
channel.description: A monthly show of no fixed format focusing on the art and craft of photography. Sometimes it’s a panel show, sometimes it’s an interview show, and sometimes it’s just the host, Bart Busschots, pontificating on his own.
channel.generator: Feeder 4.2.4(5674); Mac OS X Version 10.14.6 (Build 18G9323) https://reinventedsoftware.com/feeder/
channel.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
channel.itunes:subtitle: Monthly Musings on the Art & Craft of Photography
channel.itunes:summary: A monthly show of no fixed format focusing on the art and craft of photography. Sometimes it’s a panel show, sometimes it’s an interview show, and sometimes it’s just the host, Bart Busschots, pontificating on his own.

item.title: LTP 95: The People who Support Us
item.description:
In this solo show Bart takes some time to reflect on the people who support his photography, and encourages everyone to do the same.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp95.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: A solo show with just Bart.

item.itunes:title: The People who Support Us

item.title: LTP 94: Photojournalism with Robert Lachman
item.description:
This month Bart talks photojournalism and photo editing with retired LA Times photographer Robert Lachman.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp94.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.

item.itunes:subtitle: Bart interviews Roberb Lachman
item.itunes:summary:
This month Bart talks photojournalism and photo editing with retired LA Times photographer Robert Lachman.
Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp94.

item.title: LTP 93: Keep Learning
item.description:
In this solo show Bart shares eight ways in which he keep learning and improving his photography. We all learn in our own unique ways so Bart doesn't recommend a recipe for learning, but rather shares how he learns in the hope it helps or at least inspires others.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp93.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: A solo show with just Bart.
item.itunes:summary:
In this solo show Bart shares eight ways in which he keep learning and improving his photography. We all learn in our own unique ways so Bart doesn’t recommend a recipe for learning, but rather shares how he learns in the hope it helps or at least inspires others.

item.itunes:title: Keep Learning

item.title: LTP 92: Railways not Trains
item.description:
In this solo show, and very much inspired by last month's chat with Antonio Rosario about the railway photographer O. Winston Link, Bart digs a little deeper into the whys and the hows of railway photography. The first part of the show explores the differences between thinking about shooting railways as opposed to trains, with the hope of inspiring you to have a go. Following on from that, the second part gives some practical tips that might help you convert your inspiration into great images.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp92.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.

item.title: LTP 91: Bart Busschots on O. Winston Link (with Antonio Rosario)
item.description:
This month Antonio turns the tables on Bart, interviewing him about one if his favourite photographers, O. Winston Link. Link was a professional commercial photographer by day, but a dedicated amateur railway photographer by night (literally!).

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp91.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Guest host Antonio Rosario interviews Bart
item.itunes:summary: This month Antonio turns the tables on Bart, interviewing him about one if his favourite photographers, O. Winston Link. Link was a commercial professional commercial photographer by day, but a dedicated amateur railway photographer by night (literally!).
item.itunes:title: Bart Busschots on O. Winston Link (with Antonio Rosario)

item.title: LTP 90: Shoot like a Videographer with Wally Cherwinski
item.description:
This month Bart is joined by keen photographer and videographer Wally Cherwinsky. We all strive to come home with interesting photos, and Wally has an unusual suggestion to help you get there — think like a videographer.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp90.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Bart Busschots in conversation with Wally Cherwinsky
item.itunes:summary:

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp90.

item.itunes:title: Shoot like a Videographer with Wally Cherwinski

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 89 - Go Wide!
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 89 - Go Wide!
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart does his best to excite you about wide angle photography, and to convince you to give it a go! Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp89 Reminder - you can submit questions for future questions and answers shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 88 - Why Apple's ProRAW Rocks!
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 88 - Why Apple's ProRAW Rocks!
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart explains why he's so excited about the ProRaw feature Apple released for the iPhones 12 pro in December. It turns out the file format format underpinning it all is open, and it heralds a lot of very interesting possibilities for all cameras and image editing apps, not just for future iPhones and iOS apps! Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp88 Reminder - you can submit questions for future questions and answers shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 87 - 12 Whys of Phone Cameras
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 87 - 12 Whys of Phone Cameras
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart lays out the 12 reasons he believes phones in cameras have gone from pathetic jokes to amazing photographic tools. 2020 is the first year that Bart took 100% of his 'keepers' on his phone, and didn't fire the shutter on his DSLR even once! Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp87 Reminder - you can submit questions for future questions and answers shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 86 - Jeff Curto on Olivia Parker
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 86 - Jeff Curto on Olivia Parker
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by returning guest and photographer Jeff Curto. This is another instalment in the series-within-a-series where Bart invites photographers he respects to evangelise photographers they respect. The sky is the limit, guests can choose any photographer who's been active at any time between the invention of photography and the present day. Jeff chose to share his love for Olivia Parker's work, a photographer who has been active since the 1970s, and is still active today. You can see her work at http://www.oliviaparker.com.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 85 - Finding Inspiration in the Ordinary
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 85 - Finding Inspiration in the Ordinary
item.itunes:summary: This month's show is best described as an un-expected part two for last month's show. Bart shares some thoughts on finding inspiration in the ordinary things around us as we continue to face COVID-induced restrictions and confinement. It is possible to find great photographic opportunities in the most mundane places if you can find a different way of looking a things. Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp85 Reminder - you can submit questions for future questions and answers shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 84 - The Circus Animals' Desertion
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 84 - The Circus Animals' Desertion
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart shares his experiences finding photographic inspiration in 2020. The show was triggered by a memory of a poem by the Irish writer W. B. Yeats. Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp84 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 83 - iOS Jargon Busting
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 83 - iOS Jargon Busting
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart explains the effect of each of the photo adjustment sliders in the built-in iOS camera and photos apps. Ever wondered what the difference is between exposure, brightness and brilliance? If so, this is the show for you! Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp83 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 82 - Doug Kaye on David Burnett
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 82 - Doug Kaye on David Burnett
item.itunes:summary: This month full-time amateur photographer Doug Kaye joins Bart to evangelise the work of photographer David Burnett. David's work defies categorisation or easy description, but it is certainly both original and creative. You can see David's work at https://www.davidburnett.com/. Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp82 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q and A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 81 - Beyond the Rule of Thirds
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 81 - Beyond the Rule of Thirds?
item.itunes:summary: Bart returns for another solo show, picking up where he left off last time. In the previous show Bart gave his take on the so-called 'Rule of Thirds' — useful as a guideline sometimes, but definitely not a universal rule! If the rule of thirds is only helpful some of the time, are there other guidelines photographers may fine helpful the rest of the time? Indeed there are, but they don't have catchy names like the Rule of Thirds, making them harder to remember. Bart tries to remedy this by getting creating and coining (hopefully) humours and hence memorable names for these nuggets of advice. Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp81 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q and A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 80 - The Rule of Thirds?
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 80 - The Rule of Thirds?
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart describes the so-called 'Rule of Thirds', and then teases apart what it's good for, and more importantly, what it's not good for. He argues in favour of its use as a tool in your proverbial tool box, but that you should be careful never let it constrain your creativity. Show notes are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp80 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q and A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 79 - Kirk McElhearn on Michael Kenna
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 79 - Kirk McElhearn on Michael Kenna
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Kirk McElhearn from the PhotoActive podcast. This show is part of an on-going mini-series where Bart invites fellow photographers on to evangelise any photographer of their choice from any time in photography's history. Kirk chose to share his love of the contemporary photographer Michael Kenna. Show notes, including the images discussed in the show, are available at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp79

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 78 - Night Mode Critique with Jeff Gamet
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 78 - Night Mode Critique with Jeff Gamet
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Jeff Gamet from TextExpander. Bart and Jeff use the winner's of Apple's Night Mode photo competition as a vehicle for discussing Night Mode on modern smartphones. As well as critiquing the images themselves Bart and Jeff try to figure out how they were shot, and what we can all learn from them. You'll want to look at the images yourself while you listen: https://www.apple.com/ie/newsroom/2020/03/apple-reveals-the-best-night-mode-photos-shot-on-iphone/ Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp78

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 77 - Jeff Carlson on Pete Souza
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 77 - Jeff Carlson on Pete Souza
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by fellow podcaster and photographer Jeff Carlson from the PhotoActive podcast. In the second of what will hopefully be an on-going series, Jeff evangelises twice former Whitehouse photographer Pete Souza, the source of some of the most compelling images of Presidents Reagan and Obama. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp77

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 76 - Photographic File Formats
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 76 - Photographic File Formats
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart continues the on-going photographic jargon series. This time Bart aims to make sense of the confusing sea of file formats out there. Why do they all exist, what are they for, and which ones should you use and avoid? Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp76

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 75 - Capturing Winter
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 75 - Capturing Winter
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart ponders the art of capturing winter photographically. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp75

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 74 - Antonio Rosario on Walker Evans
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 74 - Antonio Rosario on Walker Evans
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by fellow podcaster and photographer Antonio Rosario. In the first of what will hopefully be an on-going series, Antonio evangelises photographer Walker Evans. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp74

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 73 - Computational Photography
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 73 - Computational Photography
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart shares his opinions on the next wave of photographic technology — computational photography. Bart starts with his argument as to why computational photography even is photography, and then explains why he's so impressed with what the latest generation of smartphone cameras can do. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp73

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 72 - Atmospheric Optics
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 72 - Atmospheric Optics
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart walks through some of the cool effects that often go un-noticed in the skies above our heads. We should all be keeping an eye out for these phenomena so we can photograph them as and when they appear. There's so much more going on up there than rainbows! Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Show notes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp72

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 71 - Aspect Ratios; DOF Listener Q
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 71 - Aspect Ratios; DOF Listener Q
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart explains the term 'Aspect Ratio' and answers a listener question on Depth of Field. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp71

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 70 - Lens Lingo
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 70 - Lens Lingo
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart tries to breakdown all the photographic jargon associated with lenses. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp70

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 69 - 'Timelapse' with Steve Sheridan
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 69 - 'Timelapse' with Steve Sheridan
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with Steve Sheridan of the Podfeet podcast network about timelapse photography. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp69

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 68 - A Potpourri of Ponderings
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 68 - A Potpourri of Ponderings
item.itunes:summary: This month's show is a bit of an experiment — it's a solo show, but unlike previous solo shows. Rather than focus on a single topic, Bart visits three mini-topics instead. First, a discussion about selfies and social media inspired by an article by Wes Siler entitled 'Selfies Don't Kill People', second, a discussion on minimalistic editing inspired by episode 247 of the Shuttertime Podcast, and finally, a discussion on aspect ratios inspired by episode 13 of the PhotoActive podcast. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp68

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 67 - 'Phone Photography Excellence' with Jeff Carlson
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 67 - 'Phone Photography Excellence' with Jeff Carlson
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart invited Jeff Carlson from the PhotoActive podcast to join him to critique and learn from the 10 images Apple recently chose as the winners of their 'Shot on iPhone' competition. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp67

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 66 - 'The Image has to Speak for Itself' with Clay Daly
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 66 - 'The Image has to Speak for Itself' with Clay Daly
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with photographer and podcaster Clay Daly from the Through My Lens podcast. The conversation is wide-ranging, but loosely focused around the quetion of what is and is not photography. The same phrase came up again and again — "the Image has to Speak for Itself". Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp66

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 65 - White Balance
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 65 - White Balance
item.itunes:summary: Continuing his jargon-busting series of shows, Bart explains 'White Balance'. You'll find the full set of 'Jargon' shows at http://www.lets-talk.ie/jargon. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp65

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 64 - The Art and Technology Dance with Jeff Curto
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 64 - The Art and Technology Dance with Jeff Curto
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart follows up his ‘potted history of capturing light’ (Episode 62 from November 2018) with an interview with photographer and retired professor Jeff Curto on the complex interplay between technology and art throughout photography’s history. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: https://patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp64

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 63 - More Street Photography with Antonio Rosario
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 63 - More Street Photography with Antonio Rosario
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart continues his conversation on Street Photography with Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual and the Street Shots Podcast. You'll find the first part of the conversation as Episode 61 from October 2018. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp63

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 62 - A Potted History of Recording Light
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 62 - A Potted History of Recording Light
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart takes you on a journey from photography's pre-history right through to the digital age. Photography may have been announced to the world in 1839, but it took a lot of work by a lot of people to get to that point, and of course, a lot of work to get from there to our modern smartphone cameras! Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp62

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 61 - Street Photography with Antonio Rosario
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 61 - Street Photography with Antonio Rosario
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual and the Street Shots Podcast about his street photography. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Shownotes at https://lets-talk.ie/ltp61

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 60 - What's Your Point of View?
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 60 - What's Your Point of View?
item.itunes:summary: In this month's solo show Bart ponders the question of our photographic point of view. He argues that whether we know it or not, we all have one. Should we take the time to reflect on ours? Does it it matter?Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 59 - Projects
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 59 - Projects
item.itunes:summary: In this month's solo show Bart gives a detailed answer to a question friend of the show Antonio Rosario posed on episode 209 of the Shutter Time podcast — do you shoot photographic projects? The short answer is 'yes', but there's much more to it than that!

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 58 - Vacations by Phone Camera
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 58 - Vacation by Phone Camera
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with Jeff Carlson from the PhotoActive podcast about getting the most out of the cameras in our phones while on vacation.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 57 - Digital Sensors
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 57 - Digital Sensors
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart explores the workings of the digital sensors that are at the heart of our modern cameras. How do they work? How do they differ from each other? What's the difference between CCD and CMOS? What difference does size make? What's full frame and how is it different from Micro Four Thirds? What's Backside Illumination? And much more.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 56 - Inspiration
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 56 - Inspiration
item.itunes:summary: In this month's solo show Bart ponders inspiration, and particularly how things we disapprove of and dislike can none-the-less inspire us. Bart also ponders the really big question — does photography make a difference? This show was inspired by some great discussions on two recent Shutter Time episodes (193 & 195) with Antonio Rosario, Sid & Mac.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 55 - Brightnmess
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 55 - Brightness
item.itunes:summary: In this solo show Bart asks you to imagine a line, and then takes you and your line on an imaginary journey from historghrhams, to brightness sliders, to black and white point sliders, to contrast sliders, and finally on to curves and levels adjustments. These controls are ubiquitous, so understanding them should prove extremely useful!

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 54 - Ethics
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 54 - Ethics
item.itunes:summary: This month's show is a solo show where Bart shares his throughts on how he thinks about ethical and moral questions around photography. This episode was inspired by episode 184 of Shutter Time with Sid & Mac with special guest Antonio Rosario.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 53 - Focus
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 53 - Focus
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart continues his on-going series on photographic terms. This time it's all about focus. Not focus in the art of arting sense, but in the physical optical sense.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 52 - Pondering Callings, Style AI
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 52 - Pondering Callings, Style AI
item.itunes:summary: Bart tries something new this month and shares his thoughts, feelings, and opinions on three photographic topics raised on other podcasts. Recent episodes of Shutter Time with Sid & Mac have asked whether or not we are called to photograph, and whether or not we should actively work to develop a photographic style, while Antonio Rosario raised questions about the potential problems with AI on the Switch to Manual podcast.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 51 - ISO
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 51 - ISO
item.itunes:summary: Bart continues his series explaining photographic terms and phrases in this solo show all about ISO . This is the third and final part of a mini-series on the so-called 'exposure triangle'.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 50 - Aperture
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 50 - Aperture
item.itunes:summary: Bart continues his series explaining photographic terms and phrases in this solo show all about 'Aperture'.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 49 - Family Photos
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 49 - Family Photos
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by special guests Sid Mac from the Shutter Time with Sid and Mac podcast for a conversation about creating great family photos — the kind that feel genuine and not staged. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp49 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 48 - Exposure & EV
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 48 - Exposure & EV
item.itunes:summary: It's another solo show this month with Bart chatting directly with the audience. This is the second in what will be a sporadic but on-going series of episodes, each focusing on a different photographic term or concept. This show is all about the related concepts of 'exposure' and 'exposure value', or EV.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 47 - Dynamic Range
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 47 - Dynamic Range
item.itunes:summary: It's a solo show this month with Bart chatting directly with the audience. This is the first in what will be a sporadic but on-going series of episodes, each focusing on a single photographic term. The shows will start with a technical description of what the chosen term means, and then move on to look at how it effects the art and craft of photography. This show is all about 'Dynamic Range'.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 46 - Selling your Work
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 46 - Selling your Work
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with Mark Pouley about making a start on selling some of your work. Not going pro, but selling enough to approach breaking even and having photography be a financially neutral hobby.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 45 - Thoughts on Software
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 45 - Thoughts on Software
item.itunes:summary: Inspired by Episode 161 of the excellent Shuttertime with Sid & Mac podcast, Bart shares his thoughts on how to go about choosing the best photography software for you. Not the best by some sort of global metric, but the best for you. Bart argues strongly that it matters to you that the company behind the software you choose has a viable business model, and that their vision for the future aligns with yours.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 44 - Aviation Photography
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 44 - Aviation Photography
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart chats with Let's Talk regular Allister Jenks about aviation photography. Allister has been photographing airplanes for as long as he's been photographing, while Bart is just starting to explore the subject.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 43 - Asserting Contorl
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 43 - Asserting Control
item.itunes:summary: This is the final part of a three-part solo series but Bart. In the first part, "How Cameras Work" (Episode 41), Bart describes the most general definition of a camera - a lens which focuses an image onto a plane which is in some way light-sensitive so it can record that image, and takes a quick tour through history to describe how we got to the modern digital camera. In the second part, "Understanding Auto" (Episode 42), Bart describes just what it is the little computer in a modern digital camera is doing - specifically, what sensors it uses to gather inputs, and what decisions it takes on our behalf. In this final part, Bart describes the spectrum of semi-automatic modes that exist between full auto and full manual, and why you might want to start asserting more control over your camera.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 42 - Understanding Auto
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 42 - Understanding Auto
item.itunes:summary: This month it's another solo show. Following on from last month's description of what a camera is and how it works, this month Bart explains the decisions a digital camera takes on your behalf when it's operating in full automatic mode. Bart describes the settings being adjusted by the computer inside the camera, and the inputs that computer users to calculate the values for those settings. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp42 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 41 - How Cameras Work
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 41 - How Cameras Work
item.itunes:summary: This month it's another solo show. Bart does his best to explain, at a physical level, how cameras work. Before we can take control of our cameras, we need to understand what's really going on inside our cameras, and that's what this show is all about. How we got to now is also important, so there's a liberal helping of history thrown in too.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 40 - New Beginnings
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 40 - New Beginnings
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart interviews three different guests on the topic of 'new beginnings'. First, Bart chats with Steve Stanger about his plans to do more photo and video editing on iOS in 2017. Next, Bart talks to Antonio Rosario about his plans to get back to shooting on film in 2017. And finally, Bart chats with Gazmaz about his renewed enthusiasm for shooting the night sky.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 39 - The Night Sky
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 39 - The Night Sky
item.itunes:summary: This month it's just Bart - no guest and no panel! Bart tries to inspire the listeners to have a go at photographing the night sky this holiday season. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp39 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 38 - Photography Gifts
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 38 - Photography Gifts
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario form the Switch to Manual Podcast, Allison Sheridan from the Nosillacast Podcast, and Clay Daly from the Cybrcast Podcast. As the season for giving approaches yet again, the panel discuss gifts of photography, and gifts for photographers, ranging in price from stocking fillers all the way up to the $1,000 mark! Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp38 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 37 - Smartphone Photography
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 37 - Smartphone Photography
item.itunes:summary: This month's show is guest-hosted by Allison Sheridan from the NosillaCast Podcast, and she is joined by Antonio Rosario form the Switch to Manual Podcast, Mark Pouley from Twin Lake Images, and Victor Cajiao from the Terratech podcast for a conversation about smartphone photography. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp37 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 36 - Famous Photographers
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 36 - Famous Photographers
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario form the Switch to Manual Podcast. As a follow-up to last month's interview with Jeff Curto, Bart and Antonio each showcase two great photographers from history, one from a very long time ago (at least a century), and an other from a long time ago (about 50 years). Bart championed Julia Margaret Cameron (1815-1879) & Imogen Cunningham (1883-1976), and Antonio championed Alfred Stieglitz (1864-1946) & Danny Lyon (born 1942 and still working). Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp36 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 35 - Jeff Curto Interview
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 35 - Jeff Curto Interview
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by photographer Jeff Curto talk about the history of photography, and why it matters. Jeff taught a course on photo history in the College of DuPage in Glen Ellyn Illinois for 30 years, and has made his class sessions available as a podcast. Jeff also produces the Camera Position podcast, a show about the creative side of photography. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp35 Reminder - you can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 34 - Photo Talk 2
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 34 - Photo Talk 2
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images. The is the second show where each of the panel bring along two photos to talk about - one of their own, and one by another photographer. The first photo talk episode was show 24

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 33 - Allison's Q & A
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography Episode 33 - Allison's Q & A
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Allison Sheridan from the NosillaCast Podcast. This show is a direct follow-on from last month’s. Allison sent some feedback regarding last month’s show in which Bart and Antonio explained some of the common adjustments you’ll find in photo editors. She enjoyed the show, but she had questions. Could she come on some time to ask them? Absolutely! Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp33 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 32 - Understanding Adjustments
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 32 Understanding Adjustments
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. In this show Bart and Antonio work their way through some of the common kinds of adjustment photo editing apps tend to provide, and explain both what they mean technically, and why and how you might use them artistically. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp32 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 31 - Learning New Apps
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 31 Learning New Apps
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Elaine Giles from Mac Bites Learning. Elaine is a trainer by profession, and the conversation is all about learning how to get the most out of new photography apps. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp31 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 30 - HDR etc.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 30 (HDR etc.)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch 2 Manual, and Konrad Dwojak. The topic is HDR, Tomenapping, and everything related to dealing with the fact that our eyes and our cameras have different dynamic ranges. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp30 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 29 - Video
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 29 (Video)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch 2 Manual, Mark Pouley from Twink Lakes Images, Stefaan Lesage from the Tech 45 Podcast, and Allister Jenks. The topic is simply 'video', something not previously covered on the show, even though the vast majority of modern cameras can shoot video as well as photographs. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp29 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 28 - New Beginnings
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 28 (New Beginnings)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch 2 Manual. The first half of our discussion is loosely about New Year's Resolutions, and the second half about getting the most out of new cameras and other equipment. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp28

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 27 - Drones
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 27 Drones
item.itunes:summary: TThis month Bart is joined by Stefaan Lesage from the Tech45 podcast to talk all about drones. In last month's show, Antonio Rosario recommended small drones as good presents for photographers, because you could use them as practice before moving on to a big drone. Stefaan Lesage reached out to Bart after listening to that episode with the suggestion of dedicating a future show to the topic of drones (or as Stefaan prefers to call them, UAVs). There are bound to be many drones getting unwrapped over the next few weeks, so now seemed like the perfect time, and Bart and Stefaan got together on Skype and recorded this conversation.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 26 - Gifts
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 26 (Gifts)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual & Kenny Lee. The panel discus various ways to gift our photography to family and friends, and, ideas for gifts to buy for the photographers in your life. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp26 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 25 - Projects
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 25 Projects
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. GazMaz from the My Mac Podcast. It's easy to run out of inspiration, so in this show the panel suggest some photo projects that might inspire people to get back out there shooting.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 24 - Favourite Photographers 1
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 24 - Favourite Photographers 1
item.itunes:summary: This month it's just Bart and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. In this show the panelists pick two photographers to talk about that they really like - one from history, and one contemporary. Antonio chose Irving Penn and Michael Kenna, and Bart chose Eadweard Muybridge and Flickr user C2...

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 23 - Vacations
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 23 (Vacations)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by a bumper panel: Allister Jenks from the Sitting Duck podcast, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, Konrad Dwojak, Mark Pouley, and Victor Cajiao from the Terra Tech podcast. The topic for this show is photographing while on vacation, both to try capture the event of the holiday, and the place being visited. Show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp23 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 22 - Photo Talk 1
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 22 (Photo Talk 1)
item.itunes:summary: This month Bart is joined by Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Stefaan Lesage from the Tech 45 podcast. This show is a bit of an experiment, all three of the hosts brought along a photo by someone else they particularly like, and a photo of their own they particularly like, and talk about them. There are links to all the photos discussed in the show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp22 Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 21 - Photographing People
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 21 (Photographing People)
item.itunes:summary: This month it's just Bart and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. This is a continuation of a discussion on photographing people started in the previous episode. In this instalment we discuss portraits of all forms, from environmental to traditional, with a particular focus on photographing relatives at family events. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q and A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp21

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 20 - Photographing People
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 20 (Photographing People)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Antonio Rosario and Tom Martinez from Switch to Manual. This is the first of a multi-part discussion on photographing people. In this instalment we discuss the difference the inclusion of people in shots of places can make, and we talk about street photography.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 19 - Landscapes
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 19 (Landscapes)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, and Konrad Dwojak. The panel share their thoughts on landscape photography, and offer some simple tips to help listeners improve their landscape photography. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp19

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 18 - 3
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 18 (Q & A 3)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Stefaan Lesage from the Tech 45 podcast and Konrad Dwojak. This is the third Q & A show where the panel answer questions submitted by listeners. The panel answer questions from three listeners this time - Tom asks about diptychs and triptychs, Ken asks about lenses and the cold, and Allison asks about shooting flowers. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp18

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 17 - Understanding Your Camera (Part 2)
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 17 (Understanding Your Camera Pt.2)
item.itunes:summary: JJoining Bart this month are Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Allison Sheridan from the NosillaCast Podcast. This month the panel continue the discussion of basic camera features started last month, starting by re-visiting auto-focus with some great listener input. The discussion then moves on to the thorny issue of White Balance before finishing up with a discussion of bracketing and bulb mode. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp17

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 16 - Understanding Your Camera (Part 1)
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 16 (Understanding Your Camera Pt.1)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Gazmaz from the MyMac Podcast. With the giving season freshly behind us, January seemed like the perfect month to start as two-part series on understanding our cameras. All our cameras, regardless of manufacturer, share the same basic groups of features - they all have different modes for metering light, for focusing, and so on. In this first part we focus mostly on exposure and focusing modes. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q and A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp16

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 15 - Capturing the Holidays
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 15 (Capturing the Holidays)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. The suitably festive topic for this December show is 'capturing the holidays'. The discussion starts by answering a question from listener Claus in then moves on to tips for getting the best pictures at family evens, capturing the feeling of the holidays by photographing Christmas trees and decorations, and finishes with some tips for shooting in snow. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Please consider supporting the show on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/ltpod Full Show notes at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp15

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 14 - More Buying Decisions
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 14 (More Buying Decisions)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Allison Sheridan from the NosillaCast Mac Podcast, Stefaan Lesage from the Tech45 Podcast, and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. This month the panel continue the discussion on how to go about buying photography equipment. Allison wrote in with some thoughtful critiques on the previous show, so the discussion starts by re-visiting the biggest decision of all, which camera to buy, before moving on to other buying decisions including a discussion remote controls of various sorts, and filters.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 13 - Buying Decisions
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 13 (Buying Decisions)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Gazmaz from the MyMac Podcast, Stefaan Lesage from the Tech45 Podcast, and Antonio Rosario and Tom Martinez from Switch to Manual. With the winter gift-giving season fast approaching, this month's discussion is around how to go about deciding what photography gear to buy. The panel specifically focus on cameras, lenses, bags, harnesses, tripods and monopods.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 12 - Q & A 2
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 12 (Q & 2)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Stefaan Lesage from the Tech45 Podcast, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and first-time panelist Konrad Dwojak. This is the second Q & A show, with questions covering the thorny issues of watermarking, and shooting in low-light. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Full show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp12

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 11 - Sharing
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 11 (Sharing)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, Stefaan Lesage from the Tech45 Podcast, and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. This is the fourth and final part of an on-going mini-series on the life-cycle of a photo. The series started with an episode dedicated to preparation, followed by one dedicated to the taking of photos in the field, then one dedicated to the editing of photos, and now this final part dedicated to the sharing of finished images with the world. Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq. Full show notes available at http://lets-talk.ie/ltp11

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 10 - Listener Q&A
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 10 (Listener Q&A)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Kenny Lee, Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. This is our first Listener question and answer show, and we answer questions from Scott; Allison about storing; organising our photos, and white balance cards. You can submit questions for future shows at http://lets-talk.ie/photoq.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 9 - Post Processing
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 9 (Post Processing)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Kenny Lee, Stefaan Lesage from the Tech 45 Podcast, and Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual. This month's topic is the third part of the on-going series on the the four stages of a photograph - post processing. The panel focus both on organising your photos, as well as editing them.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 8 - Shooting Small Stuff
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 8 (Shooting Small Stuff)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley from Twin Lakes Images, Antonio Rosario; Tom Martinez from Switch to Manual, and Ewen Rankin form the British Tech Network. The topic for the month is 'Shooting Small Stuff'. There's a whole other world out there if you look at the small scale, and you don't need to spend money on expensive macro lenses to join in the fun!

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 7 - Taking the Shot
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 7 (Taking the Shot)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Antonio Rosario & Tom Martinez from Switch to Manual, and Stefaan Lesage from Tech45. The month before last the topic was the first in a four-part series focusing on the four stages of a photograph's life cycle - preparation, capture, processing, and sharing. This month the panel move onto the second phase, and focus on the actual taking of the shot.

item.title: Let's Talk Photography 6 - Playing with Time
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Photography - Episode 6 (Playing with Time)
item.itunes:summary: Joining Bart this month are Allison Sheridan from the NosillaCast Mac Podcast and Antonio Rosario & Tom Martinez from Switch to Manual. This month the panel talk about how shutter speed can be used to show us the world in a different way. By shooting very fast, or very slow, our photographs can show us the world in a way our eyes alone can't. Both pan and motion blurs play a substantial role in the discussion.

item.title: LTP 5: Before you Fire the Shutter
item.description:
Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley form the Twin Lakes Images, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Stefaan Lesage from Tech45. There are four distinct phases in a photograph’s life, preparation, capture, editing, and publishing. We’ll be dedicating an episode to each of these topics throughout 2014. This month we’re focusing on the first of these phases, the work you can put in before you capture the image to help that image be the best it can.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp5.

This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon.

Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:author: Bart Busschots
item.itunes:subtitle: A panel discussion with Bart Busschots, Mark Pouley, Antonio Rosario & Stefaan Lesage
item.itunes:summary:
Joining Bart this month are Mark Pouley form the Twin Lakes Images, Antonio Rosario from Switch to Manual, and Stefaan Lesage from Tech45. There are four distinct phases in a photograph’s life, preparation, capture, editing, and publishing. We’ll be dedicating an episode to each of these topics throughout 2014. This month we’re focusing on the first of these phases, the work you can put in before you capture the image to help that image be the best it can.
Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp5.
This show is ad-free because of the generosity of listeners like you. Please considering supporting the show on Patreon (https://patreon.com/ltpod).
Reminder - you can submit questions for future Q & A shows at lets-talk.ie/photoq.
item.itunes:title: Before you Fire the Shutter

item.title: LTP 4: Finding Inspiration
item.description:
Bart is joined by Mark Pouley, Antonio Rosario and Stefaan Lesage to discuss ways of finding inspiration when we hit the inevitable dry patch.

Listen, subscribe, and get the show notes at lets-talk.ie/ltp4.
